intro: Cottendorfia neogranatensis, commonly known as the Neogranatense Cottendorfia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of South America, particularly in Argentina and Chile. The plant is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
